answers.a: Sorbitan monolaurate (E493) is a non-ionic emulsifier made from sorbitol and lauric acid; it is not the same as polysorbate 80, which is the ethoxylated derivative E433. E493 helps oils disperse in water-based foods like baked goods and desserts.

Polyoxyethylene sorbitan monolaurate refers to the ethoxylated form better known as polysorbate 20 or 80, whereas E493 is the unethoxylated sorbitan monolaurate. Both are permitted emulsifiers, but E493 has a lower HLB value suited to water-in-oil systems.
